item.title: This 1 is probably even more easy
item.dc:creator: @Zaikill Zaikill
item.description:
@Zaikill wrote:

[quote=“Bloody Wolf, post:1, topic:175416”]case 2873: if(actionTimer == 0) { addSkillXP((10*playerLevel[0]), 0); sendMessage("You get some attack xp"); actionTimer = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

yeah, it use to be 200… i changed it to 10 to see how much it would slow the XP down…

No change, i compiled about 4 times now…

Any suggestions?[/quote]

case 2873:
if(actionTimer == 0) {
addSkillXP((10*playerLevel[0]), 0); // the number 10 here its the exp got * players level in attack *
sendMessage(“You get some attack xp”);
actionTimer = 0; // Here the the actiontimer = Time for the next click
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

Just change the :
addSkillXP((10*playerLevel[0]), 0);
actionTimer = 0;

Read full topic

item.title: This 1 is probably even more easy
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

[quote=“Bloody Wolf, post:1, topic:175416”]case 2873: if(actionTimer == 0) { addSkillXP((10*playerLevel[0]), 0); sendMessage("You get some attack xp"); actionTimer = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

yeah, it use to be 200… i changed it to 10 to see how much it would slow the XP down…

No change, i compiled about 4 times now…

Any suggestions?[/quote]

Try this

case 2873:
if(actionTimer == 0) {
addSkillXP(20,0);
sendMessage(“You get some attack xp”);
actionTimer = 30;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

Read full topic
